title: Lance Stephenson on time with Hornets: 'A star normally gets the ball'
text:
Lance Stephenson on time with Hornets: 'A star normally gets the ball' Sporting News 1 day ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Steven Gaither) Lance Stephenson is preparing to start the 2015-16 NBA season on his third team in three years. He's glad to be away from the team with which he spent last season.
AdChoices The Clippers guard says he feels like he wasn’t used like a star during his one year with the Hornets.
MORE: Eight new things to get excited about this season | CP3 breaks finger
“I don’t feel that,” Stephenson told the Orange County Register . “I was just sitting in the corner. That’s not trying to be a star. A star normally gets the ball.”
Stephenson arrived in Charlotte with plenty of anticipation last summer, but saw all of his numbers drop from his previous year in Indiana. Stephenson averaged just 8.2 points in 25.8 minutes per game last season.
“I think the way they wanted me to be a star isn’t the way my game is,” he said.
Stephenson was traded to Los Angeles in an offseason deal that sent Matt Barnes and Spencer Hawes to Charlotte. He says he sees things going in a different direction in his new town.
“Definitely." he said. "I’ve got the ball in my hands. We’re moving; we’re screening for each other. Everybody touches the ball in this unit. “Anything can happen.”
